item.title: MPI Intro and Practice
item.description: MPI Intro and Practice Intro Definition wiki: Message Passing Interface (MPI) is a standardized and portable message-passing standard designed by a group of researchers from academia and industry to function on a wide variety of parallel computing architectures. Feature an interface, not a programming language Main model of HPC a cross-language communication protocol Functions Communication Point-to-point communication Send Recv Collective communication Broadcast, scatter/ gather, all to all, reduce, scan, barrier
